WGCSD Athletics will be affected by our leagues decision.
On the heals of this past weeks decision by NYSPHSAA to move high risk fall sports (Football, Volleyball, Cheer) to a condensed season in the spring starting March 1st, the IAC voted 12-7 to shift all Fall sports (including Soccer, Cross Country and Swimming) to the new Fall II season. There was also a shift in the start of the winter season as well by the league. The new anticipated seasons for JV and Varsity will be:
Winter Season - 1/4 to 2/26
Fall Season 2 -3/1 to 4/24
Spring Season 4/26-6/12
The thought process behind the shift was because of safety concerns and looming unknown budgetary concerns.

post_text: It has been our tradition to recognize all Seniors and their families on the last home game of each season. There is always a lot of emotion as athletes and parents come to the realization that there will no longer be any more home high school games to be played. This event typically provides closure to our Seniors' next adventure. Our heart aches for the prospect of what might have been. When we lose a game, we know to shake it off in order to prepare for the next one. Losing a whole season is hard to swallow, but we still believe that obstacles can be overcome. We WILL overcome this one, as well. We look to the future... and we will be stronger for it. Thank you to all our student athletes and their families for their commitment and sacrifices made to create the memories that will last a lifetime.

Gabe Planty and Matt Wood competed at the NYSPHSAA Indoor Track Meet at the Ocean Breeze Indoor Track Complex on Staten Island today.

It was a bittersweet event for the two seniors who both had an awesome indoor season filled with lots of great memories and many broken records. The results were not what we hoped for the boys today, but they both leave with thier heads held high, knowing they competed at such a high level and looking forward to thier future competative events.

Gabe Planty came into the event with the best regular season time, but was not able to match or improve that time today. He place 11th in his heat and 18th overall in the 3200 meter with a 9:34.86 time.

Matt Wood placed 6th in his heat and 29th overall in the 1600 meter with a 4:39.42 time.

Here are the full results.
https://ny.milesplit.com/meets/373070/results

Here are the results from the Section IV State Qualifier Meet held at Cornell University 2/15/20.

It was a great day for our distance boys today. Two are heading to States on March 7th.

Gabe Planty - Section Champion in the 3200 meter with a time of 9:39.5

Matt Wood (Dundee) Section Champion in the 1600 meter with PR and new Dundee School record of 4:32.64

Sam Thorsland - 18th with PR and finally breaking under the 5 minute mark with a 4:57.28

Lily Hall (Dundee) - 5th in the Triple
Jump with 35'-1.25"

Ryleigh Clark (SVE) 6th in the Triple Jump with 33'-8.25"

Madelyn Suddaby- 14th in the Triple Jump with 30"-3"

Boyd Barber - 15th in the Weight Throw with 33'-6"

Breanna Carl - 9th in the 1500 meter Race Walk with 9:25.3

Nick Wilston- 7th in the Long Jump with 18'-7.25" and 8th in the Triple with 39'-7"

It was as great indoor season for the kids. This is the most competitors WG has taken to the Qualifier meet in many years.

For two, the season will extend another 3 weeks. The state meet is held at the Ocean Breeze Complex on Staten Island, March 7th.

Watkins Glen student wins Gold medal in arts competition

Watkins Glen High School Senior Ashlyn Karius recently received The Gold American Visions Medal in the 2019 Scholastic Art & Writing Awards, a national art and writing competition.
Karius was honored for her original drawing, The All Seeing Hands.

Karius’ drawing was one of 340,000 works of art and writing that were submitted to this year’s awards, which were judged by leaders in visual and literary arts for excellence in originality, technical skill and the emergence of a personal voice or vision.

Receiving this National Medal places Karius within the top one percent of all submissions.

Karius was previously honored at the annual Scholastic Art Awards at the Arnot Art Museum in Elmira.

National School Counseling Week (2/4/19 – 2/8/19) highlights the tremendous impact school counselors can have in helping students achieve school success and plan for a career.

School counselors at Watkins Glen CSD are actively engaged in helping students examine their abilities, strengths, interests and talents; work in a partnership with parents as they encounter the challenges of raising children in today's world; focus on positive ways to enhance students' social/personal, educational and career development; and work with teachers and other educators to provide an educational system where students can realize their potential and set healthy, realistic and optimistic aspirations for themselves. Professional school counselors are certified, experienced educators with a master's degree in guidance and counseling. The combination of their training and experience makes them an integral part of the total educational program.
